reuters.unknown: F f reute u f BC TALKING POINT CONRAIL

text.title: TALKING POINT CONRAIL CRR
text.author: By Cal Mankowski Reuters
text.body: Private investors eagerly snapped up shares Consolidated Rail Corp biggest initial stock offering U S history but some analysts warned they could be bumpy ride at least near term Analyst James Voytko PaineWebber Group Inc believes some investors who bought at offering price dlrs be tempted to sell shares climbed to by midday Voytko profit taking pressure could become severe at dlr level Others say Conrail combination previously bankrupt railroads good long term potential Conrail best position to weather current tremendous price competition transportation industry general Drew Robertson analyst at Atlantic Systems Inc research firm It survive do damn well another analyst who declined to be identified He noted Conrail s freight trains serve heavy industry including steel autos major U S cities northeast U S midwest Robertson noted Conrail s traffic less dependent on coal than other railroads based east He expects Conrail to earn dlrs per share Voytko PaineWebber sees another problem six months down road when more than Conrail shares be distributed to current former employees He believes many these indivdiuals be inclined to sell stock Robertson says s hard to determine psychology average employe but even if lot stock sold hit market as one big block He doubts create big downward push on price It s hard to call analyst who requested anonymity some cases employe loyalty may motivate individuals to keep their shares he Steven Lewins analyst Citicorp Investment Management believes key to Conrail s long term outlook how able to invest surplus cash He expects Conrail to earn dlrs per share year flat comparison but by picture could change dramatically if money needed rail operations invested wisely By earnings could reach dlrs per share Lewins factoring reinvestment free cash flow at conservative rates He believes motor freight be one area diversification Conrail explore Elizabeth Dole U S Secretary Transportation whose department responsible sale Conrail noted Conrail required to reinvest rail system cannot defer necessary maintenance historic offering Conrail shares Dole visited New York Stock Exchange photographed on floor wearing locomotive engineer s cap she presented to Stanley Crane Conrail chairman chief executive U S government expected to receive billion dlrs Conrail after factoring underwriting fees other adjustments possibility recession at some time next five years another issue troubling some investors Lewins says revenue ton miles he believes climb miles year to year grow to but recession year perhaps figure could dip to On revenue side he believes revenue per ton mile be cts little changed present levels exactly same as Their basic business isn t going anywhere he says explaining why emphasizes investment cash flow Voytko thinks Conrail can remain profitable recession year He points out his firm PaineWebber forecasting recession any specific year but as example recession modest degree could knock earnings down to dlrs per share He estimated dlrs per share year dlrs next year His figure reflects mostly lowering tax rate to pct pct year Voytko believes Conrail shares merit purchase at dlr level Goldman Sachs Co lead manager offering total firms took part U S syndicate

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC POLAND FIRM ON ECONOM

text.title: POLAND FIRM ON ECONOMY DESPITE CONCESSIONS
text.author: By Irena Czekierska Reuters
text.body: The Polish government backed down some proposed price rises face strong opposition trade unions but restated commitment to economic reforms entailing tougher discipline austerity measures Following warning officially backed OPZZ unions sharp price hikes could spark confrontation government agreed food prices year rise average pct instead planned pct statement night government partially accepted demands protection low paid agreed to extend some social benefits But Polish leader Wojciech Jaruzelski at separate meeting yesterday sharply criticised slow pace reforms He told economic commission tougher discipline austerity measures greater efficiency initiative should replace waste red tape inertia He announced cost cutting measures affecting central administrative bodies OPZZ economic expert Zbigniew Kochan welcomed move on food prices This decrease considerable Kochan told Reuters today Also important fact government admitted we were right agreed to consult us over prices now on he added communique made no mention curbs on wage increases or price rises sectors including transport energy authorities prices could go up by as much as pct as state subsidies sharply reduced effort to make market more free to improve efficiency OPZZ unions officially recognised by government replaced Solidarity movement suppressed under martial law They claim membership seven million Western diplomats today climb down on food prices limited concession This small price to pay if they can push through other price rises one adding fuel energy rises more significant effect He noted there been concerted media campaign to prepare people price rises including major article mass circulation women s magazine clearly aimed at those who do shopping he Other articles official press week focused on coal sells to both industrial private consumers at far less than either production or export costs Countering scepticism opposition sources former Solidarity activists as to OPZZ s role Kochan It definitely question gaining credibility but true concern people s living standards Deputy Prime Minister Jozef Koziol authorities main aim to harm workers living standards But he also quoted by official PAP news agency as saying government to take current economic realities into account

text.title: FED S HELLER URGES BROAD REFORM TO AID BANKING
text.body: Federal Reserve Board Governor Robert Heller banking system could be strengthened by permitting formation financial services holding companies involved areas like banking insurance real estate securities speech prepared delivery New York to Bank Financial Analysts Association Heller I believe increased diversification along geographic product lines key to strengthening American banking system He he supported idea financial services holding companies advocated by Association Bank Holding Companies regulation various bank thrift insurance investment securities real estate subsidiaries be handled on functional lines Limits be placed on extension credit by bank to associated institutions all transactions to be on arms length basis Heller Measures be necessary to avoid abuse banks special position by such holding companies or subsidiaries Heller he would require holding company to serve as source strength to bank by making commitment to maintain bank s capital In other words bank be allowed to fail as long as holding company positive net worth Heller also commercial enterprises should be permitted to own financial services holding company again provision capital flow to financial enterprise if necessary Heller effects these actions would be banks at least as strong as corporations holding them customer deposits were assured while any incentive to loot bank removed Such diversification give access to national international financial services to corporations across United States Heller mean the steady decline America s banks world financial league tables be arrested by permitting them to become more competitive

text.title: CFTC SEES NO TRADING TRIPLE WITCHING RULES
text.body: The chairman CFTC Susan Phillips she does expect CFTC to restrict dual trading or to intervene quarterly expiration stock index futures their options At time we no plans to reexamine our policy on dual trading she told House Subcommittee on Conservation Credit Rural Development She be appropriate to ban dual trading because decrease market liquidity Dual trading refers to ability futures commission merchants to trade their own as well as their clients accounts Exchange rules prohibit broker attempting to benefit market impact client s order by trading on his own account before placing client s order CFTC required all futures exchanges by July to implemented audit trails permitting reconstruction all trades to nearest minute move designed part to discourage abuse dual trading board directors Chicago Mercantile Exchange proposed limiting but banning dual trading Standard Poor s stock index future pit Phillips indicated CFTC move beyond requiring improved audit trails effort to allay concerns dual trading abuses It be inappropriate at point until we see how audit trail work she response to question On triple witching Phillips recent experiments by markets to quell price fluctuations been quite successful users securities derivative instruments were still learning how to deal quarterly phenomenon Triple witching refers to simultaneous expiration stock index futures options on those futures options on certain individual stocks CFTC chairman noted commission heightened surveillance markets on triple witching day We aren t sure any other regulatory changes needed at point Phillips

reuters.unknown: F f reute h f BC U K DEALERS DOUBT HU

text.title: U K DEALERS DOUBT HUGE JAPANESE CASH INFLUX
text.author: By Phil Smith Reuters
text.body: Many London equity dealers doubt whether much publicised flood Japanese investment into U K Equity market be as large as some analysts forecast There recently been much speculation Japanese look towards U K Stock market investment opportunities on much larger scale when new fiscal year begins next month October s reorganisation stock market known as Big Bang paved way greater participation by overseas investors Some analysts believe Japanese earmarked massive sums investment Europe Both London Tokyo markets moved ahead strongly since start year But London lagged behind real terms therefore now beginning to look like giving better return on any funds reserved equity investment Sterling s firmness also means there profits to be made currency turn However many equity dealers polled by Reuters think Japanese shy away London continue to invest instruments such as U S Government securities Even if they do diversify their old stamping grounds they head U S Equity market before they come to European stock markets one dealer predicted The Japanese although very aggressive markets they know tend to be more conservative those they don t Even if they do come to London big way they tend to go more fixed interest gilt edged market rather than more volatile equities he added He also cited forthcoming U K General election as another factor keeping Far Eastern money out London stock market The Japanese do like too much uncertainty general election creates just kind keep them on sidelines one trader There also doubts whether Japanese find track records U K Companies strong enough to make them willing to invest heavily Our industrial manufacturing output may be looking better but must still look pretty uninspiring to Japanese one broker Some market participants however little more bullish do expect more although massive amount Far Eastern funds to come to London short term They point out capital gains on U S Bonds market Japanese traditionally heavy players been eroded because fall U S Dollar could prompt them to move funds out U S But even those who mildly bullish concede Japanese investors on London exchange almost certainly confine themselves to longer term investment or leading blue chip issues may include industrial giants such as ICI Hanson Trust British Petroleum Glaxo Unilever One analyst he believed if there such investment blue chip issues recently privatised companies such as British Gas British Telecom could be left out cold He election coming up overseas investors be worried Labour victory bring policy re nationalisation such companies Labour party past do Some recent rise U K Equities anticipated increase Japanese buying near future

reuters.unknown: C G T f reute b f BC FRANCE WILL FIGHT EC

text.title: FRANCE WILL FIGHT EC FARM PROPOSALS MINISTER
text.body: French Agricultural Minister Francois Guillaume warned France flatly reject proposed reforms European Community EC cereals sugar oilseeds sectors he disrupt these markets EC Commission s proposals to shorten intervention period lower monthly premiums cereals increase financial burden on sugar producers also result lower real prices producers he told farmers here I give you my word France while reject technical adjustments or serious discussion simply reply negative to these bad reforms Guillaume told annual conference country s major farm union FNSEA Federation Nationale des Syndicats Dexploitants Agricoles Community agricultural ministers due to meet again Monday to try agree package reforms to curb spiralling EC output fix farm prices Relations between government farmers become strained France recent months There been sporadic but frequent demonstrations by farmers protesting over sharp falls meat pork prices further cutbacks Community milk output But Guillaume s warning he reject reorganisation EC cereal sugar markets France being major producer both crops won him warm applause FNSEA s farmers His pledge to fight EC proposals push complete dismantling system cross border taxes designed to smooth out currency differences known as Monetary Compensatory Amounts MCA s however unlikely to avoid further protests by producers Farm leader Raymond Lacombe union planned to go ahead series major protests both France abroad against EC Commission s proposals to overhaul farm sector The Minister s proposals back up our determination to organise union action coming weeks he told reporters adding could also act Guillaume s favour on ministerial level Guillaume head FNSEA many years before being appointed farm minister spring Lacombe refused to say whether farmers felt Guillaume doing good job as farm minister There been certain advances on cutting production costs reducing fiscal costs awarding drought aid but there still areas where more could be done such as on farmers indebtedness he Guillaume told conference government make available billion francs dlrs to help producers reduce milk output to encourage older farmers to retire government already announced financial aid milk sector clear how much package announced today new aid Lacombe

reuters.unknown: A RM f reute b f BC VOLCKER REAFFIRMS G
reuters.text: VOLCKER REAFFIRMS G NEGOTIATING PROCESS WASHINGTON March Federal Reserve Board Chairman Paul Volcker urged Congress to allow the government to continue its flexible negotiations on exchange rates through procedures such as the recent Paris meeting of industrialized countries In a letter to House Banking Committee chairman Fernand St Germain Volcker said he opposed legislation to formalize international negotiations on exchange rates and to require Treasury Secretary James Baker to disclose plans for currency intervention Volcker s letter was written March in advance of the committee s March approval of the proposed legislation The fundamental policy objectives of the United States can best be implemented in a more flexible framework such as through the recent meeting in Paris of Finance Ministers and Central Bank governors Volcker said He recommended Congress not lock the administration into formal procedures for international exchange rate negotiations to achieve specific exchange rate goals The achievement of a sustainable pattern of U S international transactions and more stability in exchange rates are ones with which I remain sympathetic he said The Banking Committee s bill directs the administration to to start negotiations to reach a competitive exchange rate for the U S dollar runs the risk of build up potentially destabilizing market expectations Volcker said A requirement that Baker disclose his intervention policy could reduce the usefulness of intervention as a tool to deal with exchange rate volatility Volcker added Baker has also opposed the legislation which will be wrapped into a major trade bill for consideration in the House in late April The Senate will consider its version of the trade bill in May Reuter

text.body: Farm state Senators indicated they may broaden Farm Credit System rescue package to include aid borrowers private lenders such as commercial banks as well as farm credit system Sen David Boren D Okla chairman Senate Agriculture subcommittee responsible farm credit legislation to rescue financially troubled system should provide help to borrowers all lenders to agriculture We must provide some form interest rate buydown principal reduction relief all eligible farmers ranchers regardless their lending institution Boren Boren s statement received bipartisan support Sen James McClure R Idaho who agreed aid package should cover all lenders to agriculture comments by Senators both parties plus endorsements across the board approach nation s largest farm organization American Farm Bureau Federation system itself appeared to significantly broaden focus rescue legislation farm credit system Until now agriculture officials focused exclusively on how to resurrect failing system Boren borrowers private lenders such as commercial banks life insurance companies must be included aid package because it be fair to address only problems Farm Credit System borrowers However Boren other proponents across the board interest rate or principal buydown did say how much broad approcah cost But Neil Harl professor economics at Iowa State University told hearing cost could be range billion dlrs annually

text.title: FORMER HERSTATT DEALER CAN BE SUED COURT RULES
text.body: The former chief currency dealer Herstatt Bank collapsed on foreign exchange speculation West Germany s biggest banking crash can stand trial damages court ruled court overturned claim by Danny Dattel case damages should be allowed after such long interval Herstatt creditors seeking marks Dattel whom they accuse causing losses at bank over marks by manipulating forward foreign exchange contracts crash private Herstatt bank losses over one billion marks stunned West Germany s business community led to tightening banking regulations losses were even greater than marks announced recently by Volkswagen as result fraud currency transactions Ivan Herstatt managing director bank when collapsed sentenced to four half years prison but appealed Six other people associated bank were jailed But Dattel freed prosecution after he produced medical evidence paranoia caused by Nazi persecution during his childhood might led him to take his own life

reuters.unknown: C G f reute d f BC FARM CREDIT AID SEEN

text.title: FARM CREDIT AID SEEN BROADENED TO OTHER LENDERS
text.body: Farm state senators indicated they may broaden Farm Credit System rescue package to include aid borrowers private lenders such as commercial banks as well as farm credit system Sen David Boren D Okla chairman Senate Agriculture subcommittee responsible farm credit legislation to rescue financially troubled system should provide help to borrowers all lenders to agriculture We must provide some form interest rate buydown principal reduction relief all eligible farmers ranchers regardless their lending institution Boren Boren s statement received bipartisan support Sen James McClure R Idaho who agreed aid package should cover all lenders to agriculture comments by Senators both parties plus endorsements across the board approach nation s largest farm organization American Farm Bureau Federation system itself appeared to significantly broaden focus rescue legislation farm credit system Until now agriculture officials focused exclusively on how to resurrect failing system Boren borrowers private lenders such as commercial banks life insurance companies must be included aid package because it be fair to address only problems Farm Credit System borrowers However Boren other proponents across the board interest rate or principal buydown did say how much broad approach cost But Neil Harl professor economics at Iowa State University told hearing cost could be range billion dlrs annually By trying to draw into farm credit rescue package all farm borrowers Boren other Senators appeared to be reacting to pressure private lenders their borrowers who fear they be put at competitive disadvantage by government rescue farm credit system borrowers farm credit system nation s largest lender to agriculture pct all farm real estate loans but private lenders account nearly quarter loans on farmland pct farm operating loans official figures show American Bankers Association testimony to hearing warned farm credit rescue should be structured to favor system over other lenders As one way to meet concern private lenders several Senators farm credit system farm organizations endorsed creation secondary market on farm real estate loans called aggie mae sought by private lenders We also exploring possibility including farm credit bill establishment secondary market agricultural loans be available to all lenders Sen Boren

text.title: REPORT SAYS SOVIET ECONOMIC PLANS TOO OPTIMISTIC
text.author: by Robert Green Reuters
text.body: The Soviet economy grown at increased rate under Mikhail Gorbachev s leadership but his goals may be too ambitious according to report U S intelligence agencies report prepared jointly by Central Intelligence Agency Defense Intelligence Agency Congressional Joint Economic committee released Soviet economy grew by pct Gorbachev s first full year power twice average rate growth over previous years Gorbachev s policies to improve worker attitudes remove incompetent officials reduce corruption alcoholism modernize country s industrial equipment accounted some gains report Although many specific policies Gorbachev adopted new intensity Gorbachev brought to his efforts his apparent commitment to finding long term solutions attributes his immediate predecessors lacked Nonetheless Gorbachev s program appears too ambitious on number counts report Earlier week two U S experts on Soviet Union Gorbachev likely to be ousted three to four years if he continues his reform policies I don t think he can four years Marshall Goldman Harvard University told Congressional hearing He s moving so fast he s stepping on so many toes similar comment came Peter Reddaway Smithsonian Institution s Kennan Institute Advanced Russian studies economic report meeting targets commodity output require unrealistic gains productivity industrial output targets appear too high to allow time to install more advanced equipment None Gorbachev s proposals change system economic incentives discouraged innovation technological change report added The first significant resistance to specific policies although overall goals surfaced in both massive government party bureaucracy particularly among enterprise managers who complained they were being asked to carry out conflicting goals such as to raise quality standards output targets simultaneously report CIA DIA report predicted two to three pct growth Soviet economy over next several years Soviet Union trailed U S by seven to years advanced manufacturing technologies such as computers microprocessors

text.title: FED DATA INDICATE POLICY LIKELY TO STAY ON HOLD
text.author: By Martin Cherrin Reuters
text.body: Federal Reserve data released today indicate there been no policy change recent weeks none likely at next week s Federal Open Market Committee FOMC meeting economists The Fed continues to be accommodative provision reserves indicating there been no policy shift since beginning year Harold Nathan economist at Wells Fargo Bank These numbers other things suggest FOMC change policy Robert Brusca Nikko Securities Co The Fed sitting fairly pretty now There s no real reason to change policy Joseph Liro S G Warburg Co Inc Liro economy showing moderate growth does require immediate policy easing money aggregates may well end March at bottom their target ranges All economists agreed Fed s major concern now recent weakness dollar early week heavily supported by central banks They fear hurting dollar cause Fed to be cautious lowering interest rates further Numbers released by Fed today were all line expectations similar to data most year Fed banks net free reserves averaged dlrs two week statement period ended on Wednesday versus dlrs previous period single week to Wednesday banks borrowings at discount window less extended credits averaged dlrs compared dlrs first week statement period Meanwhile Federal funds rate average edged up to pct pct Fed s failure to add reserves market on Tuesday Wednesday surprised some but economists data released today suggest no real need to add reserves Fed s absence may be explained by lack any pressing need to supply reserves by desire to boost borrowings second week statement period to meet borrowings target Liro Warburg Liro Fed probably shooting two week borrowings average dlrs borrowings actually averaged dlrs latest statement period up dlrs prior period Brusca Nikko agreed Fed probably aiming two week average discount window borrowings around dlrs He correspond to Federal funds rate around pct nearly impossible Fed to hit any borrowings target since demand excess reserves erratic Wells Fargo s Nathan He Fed focusing instead on funds rate trying to keep roughly within six to pct band Upward funds rate pressure big reserve adding need anticipated statement period began today More Brusca believes Fed to add to four billion dlrs day reserves statement period Liro puts add need at around billion dlrs To partly address requirement many expect Fed to add permanent reserves effect next Thursday by offering to buy all maturities Treasury bills on Wednesday similar coupon pass may be required later There be greater demand funds statement period because includes close quarter Further upward pressure on Federal funds rate may come window dressing demand as Japanese fiscal year ends on March

Trade barriers would result little or no reduction current account deficit however increase inflation reduce world trade The basic cause some combination insufficient domestic savings excessive budget text.title: INDIA STEPS UP COUNTERTRADE DEALS TO CUT TRADE GAP
text.author: By Ajoy Sen Reuters
text.body: India searching non communist countertrade partners to help cut trade deficit conserve foreign exchange Wheat tobacco tea coffee jute engineering electronic goods as well as minerals including iron ore all on offer return crude oil petroleum products chemicals steel machinery trade sources told Reuters Most impetus behind countertrade began comes two state trading firms State Trading Corp STC Minerals Metals Trading Corp MMTC The two state trading corporations free to use their buying power respect to bulk commodities to promote Indian exports commerce ministry spokeswoman adding private firms excluded countertrading One trade source India targetted countries depend on Indian domestic market recently opened to foreign imports However countertrade deals still make up only small part India s total trading likely to account less than eight pct estimated billion dlrs trade during nine months ended December sources Countertrade accounted just five pct India s billion dlrs trade during fiscal ended March against almost nothing official figures show However figures exclude exchanges Eastern Bloc paid non convertible Indian rupees sources Total trade Soviet Union involving swaps agricultural produce textiles Soviet arms crude oil estimated at billion dlrs fiscal against three billion Indian countertrade being promoted mainly to help narrow country s large trade deficit still insignificant compared agreements reached by Indonesia Venezuela Brazil trade sources trade deficit hit estimated record billion dlrs expected to decline to billion current fiscal year But push to include non communist countries countertrade also due to other factors including slow growth foreign reserves tight debt repayment schedule shrinking aid trade protectionism businessmen One source India showing more dynamism promoting countertrade deals than past when deals were made discreetly because they break GATT rules As member General Agreement on Tariffs Trade GATT India cannot officially support bartering MMTC s recent countertrade deals include iron ore exports to Yugoslavia steel structures rails MMTC s recent global tenders now include clause preference be given to parties who accept payment kind goods services sold to India trade official adding policy remains flexible We also take into account other factors such as prices at goods services offered to India trade official Early year commerce ministry quietly told foreign companies interested selling aircraft ships drilling rigs railway equipment to India they stood better chance if they bought Indian goods or services return trade sources Illustrating point official South Korean firm recently agreed to sell drilling platform worth dlrs to state run Oil Natural Gas Commission return South Koreans gave verbal assurance to buy Indian goods worth pct contract against pct sought by New Delhi trade official We selected Korean firm because bid lowest he added Countertrade helping African countries short foreign currency to import goods India signed trade protocol to buy up to tonnes asbestos fibre Zimbabwe exchange Indian goods including jute bags cars But despite India s new drive countertrade some inherent problems they added It always easy to meet basic requirement trade should always be balanced one trade source The other problem often difficult to supply or buy commodities other party wants Another added Barter also restrictive We look upon as temporary measure to get over current balance payments difficulty This why countertrade been made law India does even figure country s foreign trade policy

text.title: NEC CORP TARGETS HOME ELECTRONICS BUSINESS
text.author: By Linda Sieg Reuters
text.body: The president Japan s biggest high technology firm NEC Corp NIPN T anything but worried despite growing anti Japanese protectionism soaring yen stagnant world electronics market The company s structure developed by looking ahead Tadahiro Sekimoto told Reuters interview We assumed era strong yen trade friction globalisation arrive we moved ahead on basis There s no need to change our strategy now However world s largest manufacturer microchips tiny silicon wafers brains most high technology products knows must keep looking ahead if to survive Hoping to build on existing strengths NEC now turning focus on home electronics area past weakness Sekimoto NEC wants to follow corporate slogan C C Computers Communications to create high level home electronics go beyond mere televisions video tape recorders Sekimoto Home electronics accounted only eight pct NEC s total billion yen sales on consolidated basis year ended March Industry analysts say NEC wise to target what be major growth market future but some warn company faces some stiff competition This where market going to be long time products combine personal computers video display telecommunications networks Salomon Brothers Asia Ltd analyst Carole Ryavec But Matsushita Electric Industrial Co Ltd may be there first But Sekimoto argues NEC s overall strengths carry day Many companies top computers or microchips or telecommunications but none top all three NEC unique respect he To help already high rankings NEC further increase high level offshore production makes one most multinational Japan s electronics firms company increase offshore output all goods sells overseas to pct current pct over next several years Sekimoto But firm plans to go alone expanding overseas despite moving year to become joint owner along France s Cie des Machines Bull BULP P U S Firm Honeywell Inc s HON Information Systems unit We hope to increase our share U S Market through Honeywell tie up But our basic strategy to take independent autonomous route Sekimoto company also plans to maintain independent line by continuing to make computers compatible those International Business Machines Corp IBM he Among Japanese competitors only NEC hasn t been caught software copyright disputes IBM our profits market share gradually expanded Sekimoto Once new ways linking non compatible computers perfected IBM compatibility be irrelevant What matter best hardware best software best ability to meet customers needs Sekimoto fact NEC over half Japan s personal computer market may go to court to stop competitors selling cheaper machines can run NEC software but infringe copyright on operating system NEC spokesman While industry analysts give NEC high marks looking ahead they note failed forecasting microchip demand Like other Japanese chipmakers firm left serious excess capacity when lean years followed boom times But after two years cutbacks capital investment sector Sekimoto thinks time come to boost spending again if only slightly We re going to increase production But we going to invest new product development upgrade existing plant he Despite NEC s admitted strengths analysts note company faces tough times due to stagnant markets NEC excellent worldwide capacity technology but they caught downturn may long time Salamon s Ryavec company forecasts such troubles slash parent net profits to billion yen year ending March down pct previous year although sales expected to rise eight pct to billion yen Profits improve only slightly next year rising to billion yen on sales billion

text.title: PHILIPPINE SUGAR CROP SET AT MLN TONNES
text.author: By Chaitanya Kalbag Reuters
text.body: Philippine sugar production crop year ending August been set at tonnes up provisional tonnes year Sugar Regulatory Administration SRA chairman Arsenio Yulo Yulo told Reuters survey during current milling season ends next month showed estimate almost certainly be met He at least tonnes crop be earmarked domestic consumption Yulo tonnes be set aside U S Sugar quota tonnes strategic reserves tonnes be sold on world market He if government approved long standing SRA recommendation to manufacture ethanol project take up another tonnes slightly raising target The government own reasons been delaying approval project but we expect to come through by July Yulo Ethanol could make up five pct gasoline cutting oil import bill by pesos Yulo three major Philippine distilleries were ready to start manufacturing ethanol if project approved ethanol project result employment people sharply reducing those thrown out work by depressed world sugar prices moribund domestic industry Production quotas set first time been submitted to President Corazon Aquino I think President rather wait till new Congress convenes after May elections he But there really no need such quotas We right now producing just slightly over our own consumption level The producers never enjoyed such high prices Yulo adding sugar currently selling locally pesos per picul up pesos August Yulo prices were driven up because speculation following SRA s bid to control production We no longer concerned so much world market he adding producers Negros region learned their mistakes diversified into corn prawn farming cloth production He diversification into products other than ethanol also possible within sugar industry The Brazilians long ago learnt their lessons Yulo They sugar mills compared our but they relocated many them diversified production We want to call sugarcane industry instead sugar industry He sugarcane could be fed to pigs livestock used thatching roofs or used room panelling When you cut sugarcane you don t even to produce sugar he Yulo Philippines lobbying renewal International Sugar Agreement expired As major sugar producer we urging them to write new agreement revive world prices Yulo If there no agreement world prices always be depressed particularly because European Community subsidising producers dumping sugar on markets He current world prices holding steady at cents per pound were uneconomical Philippines where production costs ranged to cents pound If price holds steady while at cents I expect level to rise to cents pound by end year he Yulo economists forecast bullish sugar market by world consumption outstripping production He sugar markets were holding up despite encroachments artificial sweeteners high fructose corn syrup But we happy Reagan Administration he Since we been regular suppliers sugar to U S when they restored quota system they cut ours half without any justification Manila keenly watching Washington s moves to cut domestic support prices to cents pound cents U S Agriculture Department December slashed month sugar import quota Philippines to short tons short tons Yulo despite next year s increased production target some Philippine mills were expected to shut down At least four mills were working during season he We expect two or three more to follow suit during next season

countries to start joint ventures as part programme to open up Soviet Union s foreign trade ties At same time number Soviet ministries enterprises received right to deal directly on world markets Previously Ministry Foreign Trade monopolised all import export business Explaining changes at news conference today Deputy Prime Minister Vladimir Kamentsev they received mixed reaction foreign press but warm response businessmen Over proposals establishing joint ventures been received foreign firms been judged mutual interest he Thirty protocols been signed projects were practically implemented including ventures Finnish Japanese West German American firms he added But Western diplomats specialising Soviet economic affairs protocols were legally binding single contract been finalised The other officials repeated terms establishment joint ventures including ground rule Soviet side must stake at least pct any enterprise He some businessmen mistaken impression foreign partners could only take profits products their enterprises exported I like to stress foreign partner can take profits all products his venture produces according to his share capital Kamentsev He added Soviet Union interested long term stable contacts foreign firms offering number tax breaks to companies invested here Speaking reform giving individual Soviet trading organisations more autonomy Kamentsev Boxed by powerful political pressure groups widespread opposition to his tax reform plans Nakasone be hard pressed to come up anything new to tell U S President Ronald Reagan key U S Congressmen they News week long visit starting April coincided news Japan recorded billion dlr trade surplus month more than pct higher than year earlier also came one day after Reagan Administration s Economic Policy Council decided to take retaliatory action against Japan alleged failure to live up to joint trade agreement on computer microchips Nakasone wants to go armed two separate packages one designed to pep up Japan s sagging economy imports short term other to redirect country medium term away over dependence on exports growth But government officials political infighting could rob both packages much their punch might even prevent one seeing light day Nakasone insisted government draw up package short term economic measures until after budget passed parliament because he feared amount to tacit admission budget inadequate But his hopes quick passage budget time his trip been shattered by parliamentary boycott by opposition parties protesting over sales tax plan Faced possibility he might to go to U S Virtually empty handed Nakasone today ordered his ruling Liberal Democratic Party LDP to come up own measures He can then tell Reagan LDP package form basis government s plans without losing face parliament over budget political analysts Officials working on government s short term economic package probably include interest rate cuts on loans by government corporations deregulation measures to pass on some benefits strong yen to consumers form lower prices accelerated public investment They record portion state investment planned entire fiscal year take place first half probably over pct Diplomats unlikely to be enough to satisfy Reagan who under pressure Democrat controlled U S Congress to take greater action to cut huge American trade deficit To complement short term measures Nakasone also likely to present Reagan details Japan s longer term economic plans high ranking advisory body headed by former Bank Japan governor Haruo Maekawa expected to come up final report outlining concrete steps to redirect economy days before Nakasone scheduled to leave Washington recommendations designed as follow up to Maekawa s report year on economic restructuring likely to cover such potentially politically explosive areas as agricultural reform land policy officials While wanting to make report as explicit detailed as possible they political realities might force them to water down some committee s recommendations subcommittee considering what Japanese economy might look like medium to longer term after undergoes massive restructuring officials subcommittee projects current account surplus fall to less than two pct Japan s total output or gross national product around or year surplus measures trade goods services amounted to over four pct gnp subcommittee also projects annual economic growth Japan nearly four pct over period very gradual appreciation yen to to dollar by around now

text.body: India searching non communist countertrade partners to help cut trade deficit conserve foreign exchange Wheat tobacco tea coffee jute engineering electronic goods as well as minerals including iron ore all on offer return crude oil petroleum products chemicals steel machinery trade sources told Reuters Most impetus behind countertrade began comes two state trading firms State Trading Corp STC Minerals Metals Trading Corp MMTC The two state trading corporations free to use their buying power respect to bulk commodities to promote Indian exports commerce ministry spokeswoman adding private firms excluded countertrading One trade source India targetted countries depend on Indian domestic market recently opened to foreign imports However countertrade deals still make up only small part India s total trading likely to account less than eight pct estimated billion dlrs trade during nine months ended December sources Countertrade accounted just five pct India s billion dlrs trade during fiscal ended March against almost nothing official figures show However figures exclude exchanges Eastern Bloc paid non convertible Indian rupees sources Total trade Soviet Union involving swaps agricultural produce textiles Soviet arms crude oil estimated at billion dlrs fiscal against three billion Indian countertrade being promoted mainly to help narrow country s large trade deficit still insignificant compared agreements reached by Indonesia Venezuela Brazil trade sources trade deficit hit estimated record billion dlrs expected to decline to billion current fiscal year But push to include non communist countries countertrade also due to other factors including slow growth foreign reserves tight debt repayment schedule shrinking aid trade protectionism businessmen One source India showing more dynamism promoting countertrade deals than past when deals were made discreetly because they break GATT rules As member General Agreement on Tariffs Trade GATT India cannot officially support bartering MMTC s recent countertrade deals include iron ore exports to Yugoslavia steel structures rails MMTC s recent global tenders now include clause preference text.title: COCOA BUFFER STOCK COMPROMISE GAINING ACCEPTANCE
text.author: By Lisa Vaughan Reuters
text.body: A final compromise proposal on cocoa buffer stock rules presented by International Cocoa Organization ICCO council chairman Denis Bra Kanon swiftly gaining acceptance by consumer producer members delegates We close nearer than ever to accepting but we still some work to do producer spokesman Mama Mohammed Ghana told Reuters after producers meeting European Community EC delegates EC consumers accepted package morning meeting predicted no problems getting full consumer acceptance Delegates on both sides keen to come to some agreement today day fortnight long council meeting they compromise requires buffer stock purchases non ICCO member countries cannot exceed pct total buffer stock purchases delegates non member cocoa issue been among most contentious rules negotiations pct figure up five percentage points earlier proposals represents concession to consumers delegates They demanded larger allowance non member cocoa buffer stock than producers wanted Another problem area delegates question price differentials different origins cocoa bought into buffer stock by buffer stock manager could fairly compare relative prices different cocoas offered to him compromise narrowed range differentials between origins what previous proposals detailed move some delegates described as just fiddling But adjustments may prove significant enough to appease some countries were satisfied original proposed differentials assigned to them delegates compromise also stated buffer stock purchases on any day be limited to pct each nearby intermediate or forward positions delegates If compromise accepted by council most consumers producers want buffer stock rules to take effect next week or as soon as practically possible full council scheduled to meet around GMT to discuss compromise could agree on then if all parties satisfied they Consumers due to meet before council

text.title: UK MAY REVOKE JAPANESE FINANCIAL LICENSES
text.author: By Sten Stovall Reuters
text.body: The British government may revoke licences selected Japanese banks securities companies operating London s financial City when they come up renewal next summer if progress made towards opening up Japan s markets to foreign competition government sources We can t say yes we going to do revoke licences but definitely being considered official His comments came after government formally urged today by cross section influential MPs to take joint retaliatory action United States against Japan Britain grown increasingly impatient Japanese trade practices There s sense urgency here now but emphasis on securing undermining our interests Japan another government official told Reuters Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher on Thursday Britain hesitate to use new powers contained Financial Services Act Banking Bill to retaliate against countries do offer reciprocal market access She clearly Japan mind government sources U K year showed trade defict Japan billion stg official figures show parliamentary motion signed by MPs today urged U K Government to coordinate action President United States through Department Trade Industry to suspend all further applications Japanese communications companies equipment approval by British Approvals Board Telecommunications all further applications Japanese financial institutions licences until authorities Japan stopped imposing what MPs called restrictive conditions on bid by Cable Wireless PLC cawl L U S Japanese partners stake Japan s international telecommunications market motion retaliatory steps came cross section MPs reflecting strength feeling inside Parliament Parliamentarians their action increase pressure on Conservative government to take firm action Officials another option now being considered by U K to refuse issuing new banking licences to Japanese institutions could be done under government s proposed Banking Bill now moving through parliament Japanese financial institutions authorised to deal London banks Tokyo London based firms authorised to do financial business officials new financial services banking acts offer Britain alternative retaliation be otherwise denied under legally binding international trade agreements The Financial Services Act gives Trade Industry Secretary Paul Channon power to stop firms engaging investment banking insurance one official This point been made to Japanese at official level number times official added Britain France now working together to urge European Community take collective action against Japan but by working within EC treaties another official British Trade Minister Alan Clark week radio interview European Community should build barriers against Japanese imports through certification procedures similar to those facing European exporters Japan There comes point where you cannot resist any longer he adding such barriers can t be put place overnight Clark issue reciprocity regarding visible trade strikes at basis whether British industry to fair access to extremely large market Japan itself very dominant position in certain aspects our own domestic market really question fairness situation only likely to worsen following news Japan s trade surplus rest world rose by more than pct February year on year to billion dlrs billion January political sources But Clark his interview issues visible trade access to financial markets should be kept separate Should Britain decide to act against Japanese financial institutions most likely focus on smaller rather than larger ones to minimise any risks to role as global business centre government sources Japan s four largest securities houses members London Stock Exchange Washington White House officials President Reagan ready to impose retaliatory trade action against Japan breaking semiconductor agreement United States There no immediate indication when Reagan might act on recommendations his Economic Policy Council to curb Japanese exports to United States but officials move could come today or early next week Trade sources actions being weighed by Reagan included tariffs on wide variety Japanese exports use semiconductors

r f BC ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT

text.title: ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT IRISH BUDGET
text.author: By Paul Majendie Reuters
text.body: New Irish Prime Minister Charles Haughey faced debt ridden economy to produce harsh budget next week to impress financial markets appease political opponents maintain his tenuous hold on power analysts Haughey who failed to win overall majority month s election only scraped back into power when speaker parliament stepped his casting vote to decide tied vote on who be next Prime Minister Heading minority government faced stagnant economy weighed down by debt he little room manoeuvre national debt now reached billion punts dlrs every man woman child on island per capita three times size Mexico s pct unemployment rate one highest European Community youngsters emigrate every year pct income tax level could hardly be raised again Haughey declining to be tied down on specifics promised on election trail to get Ireland out debt trap annual growth rate pct compared to central bank predictions pct Jobs were his top priority he his crucial first budget Haughey ruled out any increase level government borrowing forecast widespread cutbacks severe restrictions right across board Finance Minister Ray MacSharry also stressed some civil service jobs must go to trim Ireland s annual public wages bill billion punts The big question now to what extent he grasp nettle cut next Tuesday s budget Kevin Barry economist National City Brokers You to cut Exchequer Borrowing Recquirement EBR substantially swiftly He to do now Barry Noting year s EBR billion punts he Two billion be good news markets already taking view going to be tough He absolutely no room to maneouvre He cannot spend to stimulate economy I don t see any good news short term But he like other analysts rules out debt servicing crisis mean calling International Monetary Fund IMF It s too easy to borrow aboard he added steady rise sterling currency one Ireland s main trading partners been boost to Irish exporters country recording punt trade surplus February th surplus row Political uncertainty major factor punt because main political parties all essentially conservative no major economic policy switches expected New Fine Gael leader Alan Dukes who replaced ousted Prime Minister Garret Fitzgerald at head main opposition party pledged to back Haughey s budget if as expected he gets tough Haughey four short overall majority to rely on support independent deputies if all four opposition parties united to vote against him But today s climate economic austerity few politicians risk returning to polls so soon Haughey could cling to power at least another two years if he brings belt tightening budget next week political commentators say debt laden economy great national preoccupation pushing firmly into background now Haughey s ultimate dream united Ireland British out north H J Heinz chairman Tony O Reilly one most successful Irishmen international business stressed need frontal attack on national debt arguing many our children lost faith future Were there to be uptick world interest rates or precipitous decline our parities effect on our economy on provision services by our government be catastrophic he island people been living beyond means state spending spree on welfare benefits could be financed by economic growth

text.body: Nigeria France signed bilateral agreement to reschedule Nigeria s official debt to France government sources accord signed here yesterday by Nigerian Finance Minister Chu Okongwu senior French Treasury officials after talks CoFACE French export credit agency they agreement came after similar agreement Britain week follows accord between Nigeria Paris Club western creditor governments December to reschedule some billion dlrs official debt Paris Club multilateral agreement concerned medium long term debt due between September end over years five years grace As all Paris Club rescheduling accords specific interest rates other details to be negotiated on bilateral basis creditor countries involved No details discussions here were immediately available agreement signed on Tuesday Britain s Export Credits Guarantee Department first Nigeria s tour creditor nations Okongwu left Paris today London due back Nigeria on Monday diplomatic sources Nigeria hoping further bilateral accords can be concluded soon as could encourage official export credit agencies to renew insurance cover exports to Nigeria CoFACE suspended cover medium long term export contracts Nigeria but maintained cover current trade deals involving consumer goods six month credit periods CoFACE sources We open position regarding Nigeria sources adding French Finance Minister Edouard Balladur to decide whether to renew full insurance cover Nigeria due to receive dlrs fresh export credits year official agencies under structural adjustment program drawn up by Nigeria World Bank to reschedule part country s billion dlr foreign debt But these credits cannot be approved until export credit agencies agree to resume insuring credits French exports to Nigeria were billion francs down billion while Nigeria s exports to France were billion francs down billion Details Nigeria s official debts to France were immediately available

text.title: CME PROPOSES LIMITS ON BROKER TRADING RINGS
text.body: The Chicago Mercantile Exchange CME proposed stringent limits on portion futures trading can be conducted between trading rings or affiliated groups floor brokers according to CME spokesman Violators be subject to fines as much as dlrs exchange letter distributed to members earlier week proposal one reforms exchange s Board Governors suggested to curb practices come under fire unfairly limiting competition on floor Local traders claim trading among broker rings violates open outcry system prevailing futures markets Limits on ring trading be applied floor wide under proposal other reforms address dual trading apply only to Standard Poor s stock index futures pit debate over dual trading practice trading one s own account filling customer orders arisen because many traders believe can create climate trading abuses especially extremely volatile stock index futures pit Adoption Board Governors reforms hinges on April vote CME members on membership petition signed by several hundred members February bar all dual trading at exchange Defeat petition likely according to floor broker contacted by Reuters who also he welcomed limits on ring traders If members reject petition open up way Board Governors reforms CME President William Brodsky need to curb broker group trading grown as groups gotten larger A lot individuals were losing business because they were faced large scale competition Board began studying problem six months ago Under proposed reforms members broker rings defined as brokers who share brokerage fees revenues expenses deck customer orders or employee salary expenses be barred trading more than pct their personal trades each other Those found violation be subject to fines up to dlrs Broker ring members also be prohibited trading more than pct customer orders each other Fines up to dlrs be levied on violators More stringent limits were proposed on individual trading than customer orders because we don t want to negatively impact customer orders Brodsky On other hand need to do personal order very different Broker associations also be limited to having no more than one member serving on exchange disciplinary or pit committee

text.title: NEW LME ALUMINIUM CONTRACT WELCOMED BY TRADE
text.author: By Martin Hayes Reuters
text.body: The London Metal Exchange s LME decision to introduce dollar denominated aluminium contract Port Singapore listed as delivery point positive move physical traders LME dealers Earlier week LME declared pct minimum purity aluminium contract commence trading on June alongside long established sterling based pct contract LME s first dollar contract non European delivery point Board Committee looking at Singapore as delivery point other contracts Trade sources LME s new contract conform existing industry practice where standard re melt material priced dollars most commonly traded location warehouse Singapore also positive move by LME given ideal location Australian Japanese traders who be able to place metal on to warrant speedily relatively inexpensively they Hedging during LME ring sessions becomes much simpler dollar contract At present pre market trading almost exclusively dollar based but currency conversions to be done during sterling rings they added LME ring dealers new contract match more closely trade requirements possibly alleviate some recent wide backwardations Very little physical business now done pct purity metal nearly all produced Eastern Bloc countries such as Romania Soviet Union also produces pct but declined as exporter recently they Some dealers new contract may suffer liquidity problems initially as business may continue to centre on present good ordinary brand gob contract where there many holders large short positions on LME But others new contract soon attract trading interest given much metal already been attracted to LME s warehouses by backwardations LME also much more viable liquidity base new contract compared to Comex market New York where high grade aluminium futures particularly active they Thus seems likely sterling contract eventually lose trading interest volumes decline Like standard zinc superseded by high grade contract gob aluminium probably be replaced although process case may take longer they added Forming new contract establishing Singapore warehouse constructive moves by LME but backwardations make physical trading difficult totally disappear as result trade sources These premiums prompt metal become semi permanent feature over year due to increased business volatility traded options presently around stg Increasingly large granting option positions been taking place When some these declared exercised at end relevant month physical tightness squeezes around these dates commonplace they Listing Singapore as delivery point allows Far Eastern operators to deliver aluminium into LME warehouse instead having to cover But tightness backwardations seen continuing even though LME s new option contracts widen gap between declaration prompt dates These be due on first third Wednesday month whereas at present most fall on th th Backwardations remain while operators continue to grant options where potential tonnage to be delivered exceeds aluminium stock levels LME option trader

text.body: Prime Minister Yasuhiro Nakasone sounded conciliatory note Japan s increasingly bitter row United States over trade computer microchips Japan wants to resolve issue through consultations by explaining stance thoroughly correcting points need to be corrected he quoted by Kyodo News Service as saying While expressing regret over America s decision to impose tariffs on imports Japanese electrical goods Nakasone Tokyo willing to send high level official to Washington to help settle dispute Government officials Japan make formal request next week emergency talks two sides probably meet week after just days before April deadline set by Washington tariffs to take effect Tokyo expected to propose joint U S Japan investigation American claims Japanese companies dumping cut price chips Asian markets Yesterday Washington announced plans to put as much as dlrs tariffs on imports certain Japanese electronic goods retaliation what sees as Tokyo s failure to live up to their bilateral chip pact agreement hammered out late year after months heated negotiations called on Japan to stop selling cut price chips world markets to buy more American made chips Nakasone s comments seemed distinctly more conciliatory than those his Trade Industry Minister Hajime Tamura who earlier today Japan ready to take appropriate measures if Washington went ahead sanctions Ministry International Trade Industry MITI officials later sought to downplay significance Tamura s remark his main message two sides need to talk urgently issue But they admitted Japan considering taking United States to GATT Geneva based international organization polices world trade if Washington imposed tariffs Any Japanese action probably be taken under Article General Agreement on Tariffs Trade GATT they If article were invoked GATT set up panel to consider legality U S Action But officials here they hope can be avoided It may be wishful thinking but there possibility United States may lift imports Japanese government officials they confident they can make pact work They export cut price Japanese chips through unregulated distributors all but dried up after MITI instructed domestic Union leader Lord Ray Pennock The important implication Maekawa report finally looking to let Japanese enjoy fruits their labour Philip Caldwell Senior Managing Director Shearson Lehman Brothers Contents report were leaded well ahead issuance Japanese officials say they implementing report as fast as they can European ambassador who travelled country asking issue He People mentioned many things line spirit report including restructuring coal steel industries major misunderstanding private report government policy Europeans confused underlined by von Moltke s reference to leadership Maekawa report Even so Japanese officials point to September s government programme new economic measures Without endorsing report as policy officials point out government put signature to programme designed to implement report ambassador

text.title: BAHRAIN INTRODUCES NEW MONEY MARKET REGIME
text.body: Bahrain introducing new domestic money market regime to provide dinar liquidity aid centred on island s newly launched treasury bill programme Bahrain Monetary Agency issued circular to all commercial banks outlining new policy April gives liquidity aid through sale repurchase agreements treasury bills or through discounting them circular released officially to Reuters current arrangements providing liquidity aid no longer be valid except in quite exceptional circumstances Under current system agency provides island s commercial banks dinar liquidity by means short term swaps against U S Dollars less frequently by short term loans secured against government development bonds The agency considers now appropriate to replace these operations short term assistance based on Government Bahrain treasury bills circular to banks states agency repurchase treasury bills simultaneous agreement to resell them to same bank at higher price reflect interest charge agency envisages repurchase agreements normally be period seven days Bahrain launched weekly tender two dinars day treasury bills mid December year since raised total dinars through programme Bahrain s commercial banks currently liquid been making little use traditional dollar swaps offered by agency But banking sources new regime April mean banks cannot afford to hold treasury bills case they need funds central bank Banking sources more than half banks hold treasury bills although need by others to take up paper could increase demand at weekly tenders push down allotted yields slightly week s yield six pct although programme started at end year rates as low as pct Banking sources cost liquidity through repurchase accords differ much on dollar swaps But bank using dollars to obtain liquidity foresake interest on U S Currency while underlying treasury bill investment unaffected repurchase accord

important government ensure creation more jobs just transitory development The absorption enormous aid given to Philippines also poor lot been put to use government should act without further delay to text.title: SRI LANKA TO UPROOT OR BUD DISEASED RUBBER TREES
text.author: By Marilyn Odchimar Reuters
text.body: Sri Lanka uproot rubber trees more than two years old affected by leaf disease corynespora head government s Rubber Research Institute told Reuters Rodney De Mel affected trees less than two years old undergo base budding attaching clone as close as possible to trunk s base cutting off top tree once bud taken Uprooted or base budded trees mature later causing output loss estimated at kilos per hectare sixth year when they begin producing acres planted high yielding RIC variety clone afflicted by corynespora Only acres affected by disease causes leaves to fall off De Mel Sri Lanka acres planted rubber trees De Mel disease detected nurseries as early as middle but only August September became widespread Institute conducting survey to determine how many trees be uprooted or base budded Healthy trees be sprayed remain under observation T P Lilaratne head government s Rubber Controller Department monitors industry told Reuters replanting base budding to be undertaken before late May when monsoon rains begin De Mel clones nurseries susceptible to corynespora identified as RIC RIC RIC RIC RIC RIC be uprooted burned same procedures be undertaken foreign clones indentified as NAB RRIM FX PPN PPN KRS PPN Lilaratne susceptible clones be replaced by PB RRIM RRIC RRIC RIC RIC These six varieties also be used to replace trees uprooted or base budded De Mel Lilaratne planters receive rupees per hectare replanting plants be free charge But no compensation contemplated at moment he added De Mel drought Sri Lanka helped control spread disease The drought stopped disease but probably helped some way because trees been affected areas dry he Brokers disease affected prices because caused drop production Prices best latex crepe at Colombo auction week firmed to rupees per kilo rupees at previous sale

after organizing communications cocoa producing countries assessing market since prices below must buy level Special Drawing Rights per tonne specified agreement sources buffer stock theoretically funds to buy maximum tonnes within five week period but approach be more cautious buffer stock manager Juergen Plambeck buffer stock around dlrs funds buying limit tonnes cocoa tonnes already buffer stock ICCO council chairman Ivorian Agriculture Minister Denis Bra Kanon new rules good chance stabilizing prices Ivory Coast world s largest cocoa producer We established rules permit us to withdraw However some producer consumer members emerged final ICCO council meeting reservations pact Ghana whose high quality cocoa world s most expensive provides pct country s export earnings made formal text.title: JAPAN ISOLATED YEN RISES WORLD FEELS CHEATED
text.author: By Eric Hall Reuters
text.body: Japan becoming dangerously isolated again as U S Europe feel they been cheated by Japanese promises to switch export to domestic led growth officials businessmen around world As dollar today slipped to record low below yen making Japanese exporters holders dollar investments grit their teeth harder Finance Minister Kiichi Miyazawa there perception Japan reneged on promise problem goes deep centres on misunderstandings by both sides over key Maekawa report April year document prepared by private committee formed by Prime Minister Yasuhiro Nakasone led by former Bank Japan head Haruo Maekawa recommended to stop friction due to large trade surpluses Japan must make historical transformation traditional policies on economic management nation s lifestyle There can be no further development Japan without transformation Americans Europeans took report to heart looked vain clear signs historic change But Japanese remain doubtful short or even medium term prospects totally transforming their economic habits bubble frustration against what appears as Japanese prevarication burst week U S intended to raise tariffs as much as dlrs on Japanese exports to U S On grounds Japan abrogated bilateral semiconductor pact British Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher threatened to block Japanese financial firms London after Japanese placed what British say restrictive conditions on bid by British firm Cable Wireless to join domestic telecommunications joint venture On Friday European currency dealers European central banks annoyed at restrictive Japanese trade practises might leave Japan alone to intervene to staunch rise yen Eishiro Saito head top Japanese business group Keidanren spotted dangers inherent such contradictory views November when he visited European Community Related to matter trade imbalance point I found to be great cause alarm during trip to Europe excessive degree hope placed by Europeans results Maekawa report he We explained process restructuring economy away dependence on exports toward balance between domestic external demand Would take time Saito Saito s words were ignored February EC Industrial Policy Director Heinrich von Moltke came to Japan I only know your government under leadership Maekawa points to restructuring your economy into less outward looking more inward looking one Maekawa report attracted most attention Europe Europeans Americans want quick action A far better answer than protectionism be structural change within Japanese economy kind suggested by Maekawa report we hope to see changes occur near future visiting Chairman General Motors Roger Smith March Such expectations now ingrained partly fault Nakasone who heralded Maekawa s report as sea change Japanese affairs U S Officials Months before report issued U S EC business leaders met their Japanese colleagues to discuss trade problem We more anxious than ever new approach Maekawa committee does lead to speedy effective action EC Industrial Union leader Lord Ray Pennock The important implication Maekawa report finally looking to let Japanese enjoy fruits their labour Philip Caldwell Senior Managing Director Shearson Lehman Brothers Contents report were leaded well ahead issuance Japanese officials say they implementing report as fast as they can European ambassador who travelled country asking issue He People mentioned many things line spirit report including restructuring coal steel industries major misunderstanding private report government policy Europeans confused underlined by von Moltke s reference to leadership Maekawa report Even so Japanese officials point to September s government programme new economic measures Without endorsing report as policy officials point out government put signature to programme designed to implement report ambassador

indications package be ready anytime soon Reagan administration facing uproar Congress over apparent lack progress cutting billion dlr trade deficit learning now to extract results Japan dramatic action required week White House imposed unprecedented tariffs on certain Japanese electronic goods after Tokyo failed to adhere to semi conductor pricing accord between two countries shift U S strategy part designed to appease mounting Congressional anger over Japanese policies comes just two weeks before industrial nations reconvene here to review Paris agreement to stabilize currencies news Japan earned record billion dlr trade surplus first two months year just underscored need urgent action view U S officials Nonetheless U S officials see signs improvement deficit I d be stunned if we were going to derive some benefits from lower dollar soon one Paris leading industrial nations agreed to cooperate closely to foster currency stability within ranges reflecting underlying economic fundamentals or economic reality agreement envisages those fundamentals to include Japan West Germany stimulating their economies United States cutting budget deficit three nations joined by France Britain Canada agree these policies essential to redress huge global trade imbalances But analysts say markets signalled underlying fundamentals imply lower dollar rather than stable one computer microprocessor brains computer Intel microprocessors ones used all IBM IBM compatible personal computers by far largest segment desktop market more commonly called processes computer instructions twice as fast as chips used existing IBM computers based desktop computers as powerful as much larger minicomputers few years ago Although IBM be first company to introduce personal computer at least temporarily copy proof far different situation than exists IBM s current family personal computers cloned widely Personal System IBM reportedly build as many features as possible directly into computers motherboards including graphics capabilities non standard bus add on equipment new version operating system used on all IBM compatible computers word Silicon Valley take two sixth Sri Lanka s population districts letter government to step to avert serious economic hardship because Social Services Ministry already used up entire budget provision rupees by distributing help to worst hit areas letter rupees were needed six month period at least until May September Yala rice crop harvested Over tonnes wheat rice flour other cereals were required along supplies sugar lentils dried or canned fish milk some most seriously affected districts Maha October April crop been almost completely devastated letter Maha paddy output now estimated at bushels less than originally expected There were two scenarios Yala crop high forecast around bushels conditional on adequate rainfall within next three to four weeks Should present drought continue however production estimated at around bushels letter added Total estimated paddy output be between bushels or to tonnes rice year s output bushels down letter villagers most seriously affected districts been deprived any means subsistence because subsidiary crops also failed government s current budget did permit to provide sustained adequate relief to those affected Revenue been adversely affected by depressed commodity prices slowing economy Defence commitments continue to exert pressure on expenditure side cash cover payments rupees per month each family as well as handling transport distribution emergency food But such outlay funds by government be possible without seriously impairing development projects or greatly fuelling inflation economy letter letter Food Department be able to release wheat rice buffer stock to meet immediate cereal requirements provided such stocks replaced subsequently Meteorological Department country experiencing worst drought since four month dry spell text.title: TRADE BODY SETS NEW RULES FOR EURODOLLAR MANAGERS
text.body: The International Primary Market Makers Association trade organisation board week adopted new rules recommending lead managers eurodollar bond issues make market security months Currently while there implied obligation on part firms to make markets issues they underwrite there no formal obligation to do so Christopher Sibson secretary general IPMA explaining why recommendation adopted It aimed at problem lead manager who does deal disappears Sibson organization cannot force members to adhere to rule We re under no illusions legal binding force these recommendations he Lead managers occasionally abandoned efforts to support unprofitable issue just short while after been offered leaving investors smaller firms no one to buy back them Most recently when prices perpetual floating rates notes FRNs suddenly plunged most market makers abandoned securities altogether leaving investors stuck billion dlrs worth unmarketable securities on their books Sibson noted recommendation adopted by board only applies to fixed rate dollar issues helped floating rate sector out current crisis Among other measures IPMA also decided criteria membership should be tightened to exclude some smaller firms Under new rules firm must be book running lead manager during two preceding years internationally distributed debt issues denominated U S Dlrs or one eight other major currencies former requirement called three lead managed issues Sibson he expects tighter entrance requirements to pare he current list members down by six to members Smaller firms criticized IPMA s efforts to restrict membership to larger firms saying anti competitive reinforces big firms already large market share Belonging to IPMA carries certain amount prestige borrowers dealer at small foreign bank The borrower says to himself Well I can travel economy or I can travel first class he Sibson defended new rules saying We to steer course between representing interests major market makers less desirable goal representing everybody any event he size market expanded to point where former minimum size requirements were just too small Also IPMA members be required to register Association International Bond Dealers as reporting dealers submitting daily information on prices on issues they market makers effective date rule yet to be determined Dealers rule enable investors secondary market makers to better evaluate appropriate market price their securities Such rule make investors more confident trading eurobond market increase liquidity they Dealers form reporting yet been spelled out But previous discussion reporting requirement considered firms listing closing price given security as well as high low day Members also agreed at IPMA meeting on implementation new communications system enables lead manager to invite all potential management group members to deal at same time
