reuters.unknown: C T f reute u f BC ICO BOARD SEEN UNLIKE

text.title: ICO BOARD SEEN UNLIKELY TO SET NEW COFFEE TALKS
text.author: By Lisa Vaughan Reuters
text.body: Chances International Coffee Organization ICO executive board meeting week agree to resume negotiations on export quotas soon look remote ICO delegates trade sources ICO observers doubted Brazil or key consuming countries ready to give sufficient ground to convince other side reopening negotiations again be worthwhile they ICO talks on quotas month broke down after eight days when producers consumers failed to reach agreement Since we seen signs change other positions s difficult to see positive outcome at stage Brazilian delegate Lindenberg Sette But quotas must be negotiated sometime he U S indicated open to dialogue on quotas but Brazil must be flexible rather than refuse to lower export share as did negotiations delegates At week s March April meeting member ICO board scheduled to discuss current market situation reintroduction quotas verification stocks some administrative matters according to draft agenda fact Brazilian Coffee Institute president Jorio Dauster Assistant U S Trade Representative Jon Rosenbaum chief Colombian delegate Jorge Cardenas attending meeting signalled to most market watchers be non event as far as negotiating quotas concerned I imagine there be lot politicking among producers behind closed doors to work up some kind proposal by September the next scheduled council meeting Bronwyn Curtis Landell Mills Commodities Studies Traders delegates they seen no sign date be set earlier council meeting If stalemate continues much longer analysts expect coffee agreement end up operating without quotas remainder life to September When talks broke down U S Brazil largest coffee consumer producer respectively blamed one another sabotaging negotiations by refusing to compromise Brazil wanted to maintain previous export quota shares under allocated pct world coffee exports but consumers small group producers pressed shares to be redistributed using objective criteria threatened Brazil s share At recent meeting Managua Latin American producers Costa Rica Honduras they were willing to put their objections as members group eight ICO dissident producers aside order to stem damaging decline prices Nicaraguan External Trade Minister Alejandro Martinez Cuenca told reporters Saturday He London to brief producers on Managua meeting However other producers they were aware move toward producer solidarity London coffee prices closed at stg tonne today down around at beginning March

reuters.unknown: RM A f reute r f AM TRADE NEWS ANALYSIS

text.title: ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT U S CONGRESS RAPS JAPAN
text.author: By Jacqueline Frank Reuter
text.body: The U S Congress making Japan enormous worldwide trade surplus symbol U S trade crisis focus efforts to turn around America s record trade deficit Japan come to symbolize what we fear most trade challenge to our high technology industries threat government nutured competition multitude barriers to our exports Senate Democratic Leader Robert Byrd If we can find way to come to terms Japan over trade problems we can manage our difficulties other countries West Virginia Democrat at Senate Finance Committee hearing on trade bill Byrd House Speaker Jim Wright Texas Democrat made trade legislation priority year wide ranging bill being readied probable House approval next month Japan s bilateral trade surplus jumped billion dlrs to billion dlrs year surplus rose to billion dlrs February billion dlrs January Congress points to record billion dlrs U S trade deficit slow response trade imbalance to dollar s decline world currency markets as reason to press Japan to buy more U S goods They particularly dismayed by rapid deterioration U S exports sophisticated computer technology response to growing anger pressure by U S semiconductor industry President Reagan Friday announced he intended to raise tariffs as much as dlrs on Japanese electronic goods retaliation Japan s failure to abide by U S Japanese semiconductor agreement Congress also been been angered by administration s lack success Japan on host other trade issues including beef citrus automobile parts telecommunications goods financial services bulk House trade bill written week four committees package trade sanctions measures to force administration take tough action against foreign trade barriers unfair competition Although most provisions do single out Japan many cases their impact be to restrict imports Japanese products or make them more expensive higher duties cornerstone trade legislation passed House Ways Means Committee by vote to focus to force President Reagan to retaliate against unfair foreign competition to make easier U S industries to win temporary relief surges imports most controversial issue amendment to restrict imports if countries such as Japan large surpluses do buy more U S goods left April vote by House Rep Richard Gephardt Democratic presidential aspirant Missouri support Wright other key Democrats to press passage amendment measure most impact on Japan West Germany Taiwan South Korea If Japan example does reduce barriers by mid United States set import quotas or tariffs to cut Japanese surplus by ten per cent year three years I m tired going into companies having managers say to me We re over competing Japan because we can t compete marketplace argument needs to be taken away American business Gephardt administration could support trade bill containing such provision

reuters.unknown: RM A f reute r f BC U S CORPORATE FINANC

text.title: U S CORPORATE FINANCE NEW ZEALAND DLR FRNS
text.author: By John Picinich Reuters
text.body: Floating rate notes denominated foreign currency relatively new wrinkle on Wall Street probably be issued infrequently because so called window opportunity opens closes quickly traders say In just two days we as many issues As result market became glutted one trader He window depends more on supply than on foreign exchange or interest rate risk at least moment Obviously currency risk important But there limited number investors right now paper he On Thursday Bear Stearns Co sole managed New Zealand dlr offering three year floating rate notes issued by Ford Motor Credit Co unit Ford Motor Co F initial rate notes be set on April quarterly after at basis points below day New Zealand bank bill rate They non callable life followed by week another Bear Stearns led offering same amount New Zealand dollar notes Dow Chemical Co DOW initial rate also to be initially set on April quarterly after at basis points below same day New Zealand rate Because Dow Chemical notes carried interest rate floor pct issue saw strong investor demand underwriters But Ford Credit notes Friday s offering New Zealand dlrs floating rate notes due issued by General Electric Co s GE General Electric Credit Corp via Prudential Bache Securities Inc did such floor Obviously two firms did want to issue floaters face risk New Zealand rates falling sharply underwriter away syndicates He others noted New Zealand day rate pct late week underwriter familiar Dow Chemical deal pointed out because interest rate currency swaps Dow did issuer felt comfortable setting rate floor Domestic offerings foreign currency denominated date first surfaced Fall By using currency rate swaps companies can sell debt pays high interest rate foreign currency like Australian or New Zealand dollars But issuers actually realize savings on borrowing costs I say every company issued foreign currency debt saved some basis points when compared to same maturity plain vanilla U S issues analyst Investors mainly institutions were attracted to early issues because high interest rates They were willing to absorb foreign currency risk until mid when sharp slides posted by Australian New Zealand dollars brought such issuance to quick halt until late year after currencies stabilized companies again started issuing debt denominated Australian New Zealand dollars But many investors still shied away debt remembering mid downturn Australian New Zealand dollars analysts noted To attract some those investors back to fold underwriters like Bear Stearns decided to structure foreign currency issues as floating rate debt sources occurred against backdrop uncertainty over course U S interest rates intermediate term predictions by number economists Treasury yields rise second half year sources noted Bear Stearns officer more than half Ford Credit notes were sold by late Friday afternoon second day offering That quicker than some recent fixed rate New Zealand dollar note issues he However underwriters away Bear Stearns syndicate issue may sold even faster if Prudential Bache did offer General Electric Credit notes on Friday They pointed out Ford notes were rated by Moody s Investors AA minus by Standard Poor s while General Electric notes same interest rate terms were also non callable to maturity carried top flight AAA ratings by both agencies We sold to pct GE notes first day sales on Friday afternoon I m happy results officer on Prudential Bache s syndicate desk Investors pay U S dollar equivalent foreign currency denominated notes underwriters Investment bankers next floating rate issue New Zealand or Australian dollar denominated debt probably few weeks away I like to underwrite deal day But Dow Ford GE offerings marketplace enough time being Prudential Bache officer admitted Meanwhile IDD Information Services day corporate visible supply fell to billion dlrs week billion dlrs previous week

reuters.unknown: V RM f reute u f AM CHIRAC ECONOMY

text.title: CHIRAC URGES EXCHANGE RATE STABILITY PLAN
text.body: French Prime Minister Jacques Chirac called on leading Western nations to set up mechanism put stop to volatile foreign exchange rates speech prepared delivery to businessmen bankers New York Chirac monetary stablility key element bringing world financial system back to health The industrialized states should agree to set up monetary framework provide necessary stability as well as sufficient flexibility to allow ajustments when needed Chirac This requires monitoring alert mechanism permit timely concerted reaction he prime minister on first day three day visit to United States February Paris accords agreed by Group Five industrial nations should serve as basis new mechanism Under Paris accords United States Britain France West Germany Japan agreed to stabilize exchange rates around existing parities But only five weeks after they were signed they failed to stop dollar tumbling to record lows against yen Chirac means to monitor exchange rate movements were readily available What needed political to use these more completely spirit Paris accords other points his speech Chirac called on countries high trade surpluses apparent reference to Japan to open up their markets stimulate demand He warned United States protectionist measures as debated U S Congress bring tough response nation European Community Europe very sensitive to every rumour protectionism react energy solidarity because does want to ruin chances recovery Reagan administration seeking to tone down tough trade bill if passed require president to retaliate against countries deemed to discriminate against U S Goods Chirac also appealed effort developed countries to help Third World by reducing interest rates stimulating commodity prices No stock pile mechanism can run counter to underlying trend market These agreements must be complemented by financial aid to developing countries hardest hit by decline Chirac he hoped concrete steps could be reached on these issues at forthcoming international meetings International Monetary Fund World Bank session Washington June summit seven leading western nations Venice

reuters.unknown: F f reute u f BC TALKING POINT WALL ST

text.title: TALKING POINT WALL STREET STOCKS
text.author: By Cal Mankowski Reuters
text.body: Investors who been riding bull market U S stocks got stinging reminder today how unexpected news can trigger sharp reversals The market ripe some type pullback Frank Korth analyst at Shearson Lehman Brothers He over weekend investors pondered President Reagan s decision to impose tariffs on Japanese electronic goods some concluded step could signal beginning trade war Dow Jones Industrial Average plunged points minutes before stabilizing making partial recovery Korth believes there been over reaction near term traders might want to step buy one half or one quarter new investments they been considering We re still bull market William Raftery Smith Barney Harris Upham Co He thinks history shown such sharp pullbacks natural part bull markets The bear usually strikes slowly he Raftery noted blue chips been forefront rally took market to record highs week today s decline he big name stocks were coming more into more normal alignment general market Charles Comer Moseley Securities Corp ultimately pullback could prove to be pre shock to long awaited correction But now he believes bull market remains intact However could take several weeks market to complete distribution process along way there be rallies Comer thinks premature to conclude today s action signaled formation market top He thinks market can hold low to mid area on Dow index This probably correction been expected Crandall Hays Robert W Baird Co Hays noted market breadth began to deteriorate week He morning investors saw dollar down further interest rates up gold up The trade problem got people spooked all bad things were happening at once he This correction could take us down points we re half way there now he early today He thinks downward move stock prices could be over couple weeks Business conditions seem to be getting better according to what he hears broad cross section companies retailers to machinery manufacturers The market high people were looking correction so excuse market to go down Alan Ackerman Gruntal Co He believes investors be mood extreme caution or slightly negative near term Ackerman thinks U S attempting to fire shot across Japan s bow let them know we re serious having closer trade ties But nevertheless investors been rattled by a perception full scale trade war possible Ultimately unless there accord effects could be higher interest rates unemployment he I anticipate further correction later week Harry Laubscher Tucker Anthony R L Day He thinks pullback the start overdue correction between six pct market highs Although investors now new reason to worry higher interests rate return inflation Laubscher says it end bull market The market looking reason to knock itself down little bit trade sanctions coming largely as surprise think market attached itself to Gary Ciminero Fleet Financial Group

reuters.unknown: A RM f reute r f BC PARIS MEET AGREED NOT

text.title: PARIS MEET AGREED NOT TO PUBLISH BANDS LAWSON
text.body: U K Chancellor Exchequer Nigel Lawson meeting six major industrial nations Paris month agreed to publish any bands connection their pact to stabilise currencies Questioned by parliamentary select committee why participating countries announced any bands Lawson replied we all agreed be much more sensible to When asked whether meant informal joint currency float set ranges arranged Paris Lawson I do want to reveal precise nature agreement so as to make easy speculation against accord Lawson Paris accord presumed individual countries take corrective action if their currency began reacting significantly to domestic macroeconomic factors But if such movements were due to extraneous factors Lawson other pact countries come to aid through concerted intervention on foreign exchanges It clear both Germany Japan having difficulty adjusting to their very large exchange rate appreciations making their economies more domestically oriented just as taking time United States to make own economy more export oriented Lawson his oral evidence to Parliament s Select Treasury Committee Lawson repeated he happy pound s current level adding It objective To try to keep around level He perception sterling on foreign exchanges changed since steep drop oil prices largely because pound weathered period so successfully There been reassessment sterling s fundamentals Lawson He disagreed what he termed the grossly exaggerated claim real U K Interest rates were much higher than those other major industrialsed countries Using as reference key three month sterling interbank rate as quoted London Lawson Britain now real interest rate level pct same as Japan did only percentaage point above Group Five average Lawson confirmed over medium longer term government s objective zero inflation He government s intention PSBR constant at pct GDP is modern equivalent balanced budget doctrine He added to allow debt GDP ratio to remain constant on anything other than zero inflation basis simply recipe accelerating inflation
